hopobject.body:
Trade Show FAQs regarding BeagleBoard.org

Where do I find answers to frequently asked questions?

While beagleboard.org is the canonical source for information regarding the Foundation, the eLinux wiki is intended to be the canonical resource for the community to collaborate on frequently asked questions:

  • http://elinux.org/Beagleboard:BeagleBone_Black_FAQ

What is BeagleBoard.org and what makes that interesting?

  • BeagleBoard.org is a non-profit corporation
  • seeking to improve access to programming and electronics,
  • especially through open source collaboration with tools like Linux and Node.JS.

By taking a collaborative, open source approach, BeagleBoard.org enables a broad ecosystem of partners and derived solutions in software, hardware, and resources, including books, curriculum, websites and more.

What people do with BeagleBoard.org designs enables starting quickly and eliminating barriers as you move forward. We like to say BeagleBoard.org supports you going from "Kindergarten to Kickstarter".

What are you showing off at the booth today?

We are doing hands-on tutorials at noon and 2PM. The noon sessions is meant to be a bit more of a "first experience" and the 2PM sessions are intended for spending some hands-on time working on more advanced design challenges you might have.

We are showing off some of the real-time capabilities of the BeagleBone Black by demonstrating a 3D printer that is running Linux at the same time as providing real-time path-planning and stepper motor pulses. These capabilities are unique to the BeagleBone Black in this product space. The combination of Linux and real-time capabilities are also being shown off with the BeagleLogic logic analyzer, entirely done with software running off the off-the-shelf BeagleBone Black and open source software. BeagleLogic supports 14 channels at 100 megasamples per second and will analyze over 30 protocols.

Where can you buy BeagleBone Black?

BeagleBone Black is sold through a number of popular on-line distributors and brick-and-mortar retailers. For on-line distributors, see:
http://beagleboard.org/black.

What is the relationship between BeagleBoard.org and Texas Instruments, and why is TI at the BeagleBoard.org booth?

What is the relationship between BeagleBoard.org and Element14, and why is Element14 at the BeagleBoard.org booth?

How is BeagleBoard.org and BeagleBoard.org products like BeagleBone Black different than Raspberry Pi or Arduino and their products?

Is BeagleBoard.org really open?
  • We try to be part of the solution and not the problem.

What is next for BeagleBoard.org?

When is BeagleBoard-X15 going to release?

Does BeagleBone Black support WiFi?

Does BeagleBone Black support video?

How do the give-aways work?

What are the rules for display of demos?

  • Business cards and flyers should be placed X.
